@ijuma Is there a JIRA or release notes for this?  Nothing in [0.10.2.1 release notes](https://archive.apache.org/dist/kafka/0.10.2.1/RELEASE_NOTES.html) or in conversation at #2777 .

This appears to fix some serious issues I was having with StateStores and SessionStores in particular.  Since I can't find mention of this elsewhere online, I'll document here what I've found:

* Naked StateStore name (without application ID prefix) was provided as the subject, causing collisions in the schema registry with other applications.
* For session stores, a bogus "sessionkey-key" subject was hard coded!
* SessionStore.fetch() would fail when using a MockSchemaRegistryClient, because reads used the store's key serde (=> subject = store name) while writes used the hardcoded "sessionkey" subject (MockSchemaRegistryClient is not smart enough to assign the same schema registered under different subjects the same ID -- broke unit tests using Spring's EmbeddedKafka with MockSchemaRegistryClient).

Changing subject names is not a completely backwards compatible change!  Fortunately it's a minor difference (since KafkaAvroSerializer IDs are global and the subject is only used for in-memory caching), but this breaks unit tests that verify the schema registry, or any other references to the old state-store-specific subject names.  Don't get me wrong -- this is an extremely welcome fix, but it's a bit bigger than a HOTFIX.

I think it's a case of not clearing the cached `Configuration` before the relevant code is executed.
An interesting question is how the additional state in `KafkaChannel` affects `ClusterConnectionStates`. The answer may be that it doesn't, but worth thinking about.

It looks like the recent transient failures are known issues: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-5183, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-5182, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-5175. In one of the previous builds, I saw a failure in kafka.server.LogRecoveryTest.testHWCheckpointWithFailuresSingleLogSegment. This could be related to this patch and there is no active JIRA, so I'm trying to reproduce it locally.
